parachute module¶

class parachute.Parachute(cd0_parachute, z_deploy, x1_factor, cx_factor, type_string)[source]¶

Bases: object

abstract compute_cd(mach)[source]¶

Abstract method to compute the drag coefficient based on the Mach number.

Parameters:

mach – Mach number.

abstract compute_delta_t_infl(v)[source]¶

Abstract method to compute the time required for inflation based on the velocity.

Parameters:

v – Velocity.

abstract compute_dragArea_chute(t, z, v, mach)[source]¶

Abstract method to compute the drag area of the parachute based on time, altitude, velocity, and Mach number.

Parameters:

  • t – Time.

  • z – Altitude.

  • v – Velocity.

  • mach – Mach number.

compute_opening_load(z, v)[source]¶

This method computes a likely value of the force at parachute deployment. The used formula is given by Knacke’s book, see report. The member self.opening_force is set accordingly.

Parameters:

  • z – Current altitude.

  • v – Current velocity.

compute_porosity(type_chute)[source]¶

This function interpolates the plot 6-23 in Knacke’s book to compute the required total porosity for a given application.

Parameters:

type_chute – 2 -> stabilization chute, 3 -> drogue chute.

abstract create_design()[source]¶

Abstract method to create the parachute design.

required_S0(val_max, mass, z, option)[source]¶

This method computes the necessary nominal canopy area for both the main and the drogue parachute.

Parameters:

  • val_max – Either the final descent velocity that the main parachute must reach (option == 1) or the Mach number that the drogue chute must reach for the deployment of the main (option == 2)

  • mass – Mass of the payload [kg].

  • z – Current altitude [m].

  • option – 1 or 2. Option 1 calculates for the main parachute, option 2 calculates for the drogue parachute.

abstract write_out(file)[source]¶

Abstract method to write the parachute design to a file.

Parameters:

file – File object to write the design to.
